result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas W. Truckey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Thomas W. Truckey is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Thomas W. Truckey was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Thomas W. Truckey was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Thomas W. Truckey was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
**  Pay supervision fees.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
**  Pay DNA Surcharge.
**  Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 60 days. - Atty David Patton - (Advocate Counsel)
  Probation & Parole to notify the court, in writing, of any arrests within 5 days of receipt of information.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas W. Truckey

records.addlTxt: Case Completion
Count 4 dismissed on State's motion
Conditions of Probation

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Drew Lehman appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person along w/Atty David Patton.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Deft pleads guilty to counts 1, 2, & 3; found guilty by the Court.  Remaining count dismissed on State's motion.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for two years on each count concurrent.  See conditions.  DNA surcharge ordered; sample previously ordered.  Appeal rights.  Bond should be applied towards financial obligations.
Plea hearing on March 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.

01:12 - 01:18 PM  
  Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney David Patton.  Clerk PT  Referred to Br 3 for Plea Hearing on 3/24/22 @ 1030am.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing.  Probable cause found.  Information filed today, receipt acknowledged, reading wiaved.  Not guilty ple entered.  Bond is continued.    jk
at the request of Atty Patton , STC on 03-03-22 is rescheduled to 03-11-22 at 1pm Intake. DA notified.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Atty David Patton
David Patton

Minutes:  21CT621/22CM75/21TR7619.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Alex Huber appeared for the State.  Deft appeared along w/Atty David Patton.  Cases are resolved.  Atty Patton reports he was only appointed on 21CT621.  Court will appoint Atty Patton on 22CM75 for purposes of resolving the cases today.  

21CT621 - deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Count 2 is dismissed on State's motion.  

22CM75 - deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.  

21TR7619 - dismissed on State's motion.

Sentencing arguments made.  Deft fined $500 plus costs on each count.  180 DTP.  In default, 22 days work crew or 22 days KCJ on each.  DNA surcharge ordered; sample previously provided.  Appeal rights

Atty Patton reports the deft has a pending CF case in this branch.  Inquires of the court if advocate counsel should be appointed on the CF file as well since deft does not qualify for SPD.  Court will appoint.  Deft ordered to pay $50/mo commencing 3/15/22.  In addition, the Court puts restraint on any tax refund the deft may received after his financial obligations have been paid.
**DENIED**
Status conference on March 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant, Thomas W. Truckey, appeared.  Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE is not eligible for SPD and Advocate counsel.    DE waives time for preliminary hearing  to attempt to retain private counsel.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
forwarded to Intake
